entities.description: "LANI is an event or task designed to evaluate an agent's ability to follow navigation instructions in an environment with landmarks."
"CHAI is an organization that combines navigation and manipulation tasks in a simulated household environment, using the CHALET simulator."
"Amazon Mechanical Turk is a crowdsourcing platform used to collect a corpus of navigation instructions for the LANI task."
"Unity3D is the technology used to implement the environment simulator for the LANI task."
"The CHALET simulator is a 3D house simulator used by the CHAI organization to create a complex, simulated household environment."
"Ng et al., 1999 refers to a group of researchers or authors who contributed to the shaping term component of the reward function."
"Williams, 1992 refers to a researcher or author who contributed to the method of approximating the gradient by sampling an action using the policy."
"Recht et al., 2011 refers to a group of researchers or authors who contributed to the Hogwild! method used for updating parameters."
"Yan et al., 2018 refers to a group of researchers or authors who developed the CHALET simulator used by the CHAI organization."
"The agent in the text refers to a computational entity that is being trained to follow navigation instructions and perform tasks in a simulated environment."
"The goal position is a specific location in the environment that the agent is trying to reach, as part of the navigation task."
"The first person view refers to the perspective from which the agent observes the environment, as if the agent were a person."
"An RGB image is the type of visual data the agent receives as input when observing the environment, representing color images."
"A scalar reward is a single numerical value provided to the agent as feedback for its actions in the environment."
"The socket API is the interface used by the simulator to control the agent and the environment in the LANI task."
"Task completion accuracy is a metric used to evaluate how accurately the agent completes the navigation task."
"Stop distance error is a metric used to evaluate the agent's performance, specifically how close the agent stops to the goal."
"Aerial distance refers to the distance measured from above, used to determine if the agent has completed the task within the required proximity to the goal."
"Development in this context refers to the process of refining and improving the agent's performance on the navigation task."
"Qualitative analysis is the process of analyzing the language challenge presented by the corpus, which is part of the development process."
"Segmented instructions are instructions that are broken down into parts, each corresponding to a specific action or segment of the path."
"Demonstrations refer to the act of showing how to perform a task, in this case, how to follow the navigation instructions."
"An overhead view is the perspective from which the workers provide instructions, observing the environment from above."
"The drone icon represents the agent in the environment, used to visualize the path and the agent's position."
"The follower path is the path that the agent takes while following the navigation instructions, visualized in the environment."

relationships.description: "LANI uses Amazon Mechanical Turk to crowdsource navigation instructions."
"LANI's environment simulator is implemented using Unity3D technology."
"CHAI uses the CHALET simulator to create a simulated household environment for their tasks."

entities.description: "CHAI is an organization that has developed a corpus combining navigation and simple manipulation in a simulated household environment."
"The CHALET simulator is a 3D house simulator used by CHAI, providing multiple houses with rooms for navigation and object manipulation tasks."
"Yan et al., 2018 are the authors who provided the full details of the CHALET simulator and evaluation metrics for the CHAI corpus."
"Amazon Mechanical Turk is a crowdsourcing platform used by CHAI to collect a corpus of navigation and manipulation instructions."
"Misra et al. (2017) are referenced as a baseline approach in the experimental setup for the CHAI corpus."
"Chaplot et al. (2018) are referenced as a baseline approach in the experimental setup for the CHAI corpus."
"Janner et al. (2018) are referenced for a method of goal prediction in the evaluation of the CHAI corpus."
"LANI is another organization mentioned in the context of the CHAI corpus, possibly related to language or instruction analysis."
"NAVIGATION is an event type in the CHAI corpus, representing action sequences that require movement and end with the STOP action."
"INTERACTION is an event type in the CHAI corpus, representing sequences of movement actions that end with an INTERACT action."
"INTERACT is an event in the CHAI corpus where the agent interacts with objects, requiring a 2D position in the agent’s view."
"STOP is an event in the CHAI corpus where the agent ceases movement, used as an endpoint for NAVIGATION and INTERACTION sequences."
"TURNLEFT is an event in the CHAI corpus where the agent turns left, one of the five actions the agent can take."
"TURNRIGHT is an event in the CHAI corpus where the agent turns right, one of the five actions the agent can take."
"FORWARD is an event in the CHAI corpus where the agent moves forward, set at a distance of 0.1, one of the five actions the agent can take."
"Ray casting is a technology used in the CHAI corpus for inferring the goal location, especially for INTERACTION goals that are not on the ground."
"Horizon refers to the limit or boundary within which the agent operates in the CHAI corpus, with a specified horizon of 40 for both domains."
"Goal prediction is an event in the CHAI corpus where an additional RNN predicts the sequence of intermediate goals given the instruction only."
"CENTER baseline is a concept in the CHAI corpus where the method always predicts the center pixel for goal prediction."
"Task completion (TC) is an evaluation metric in the CHAI corpus for measuring whether the agent has successfully completed a task."
"Manipulation accuracy (MA) is an evaluation metric in the CHAI corpus for comparing the set of manipulation actions to a reference set."
"Stop distance (SD) is an evaluation metric in the CHAI corpus that measures the distance of the agent’s final state to the final annotated position."

relationships.description: "CHAI uses the CHALET simulator for their navigation and manipulation tasks in a simulated household environment."
"CHAI's corpus and evaluation methods are based on the work detailed by Yan et al., 2018."
"CHAI collected their corpus of instructions using Amazon Mechanical Turk's crowdsourcing service."
"CHAI compares its approach against the baseline established by Misra et al. (2017) in their experimental setup."
"CHAI compares its approach against the baseline established by Chaplot et al. (2018) in their experimental setup."
"CHAI evaluates its goal prediction method against the one proposed by Janner et al. (2018)."
"CHAI and LANI are both mentioned in the context of corpora, possibly indicating a relationship or comparison between the two."
"CHAI includes NAVIGATION as one of the two types of goals in their model for executing instructions."
"CHAI includes INTERACTION as one of the two types of goals in their model for executing instructions."
"NAVIGATION events in CHAI end with the STOP action, indicating a sequential relationship."
"INTERACTION events in CHAI end with an INTERACT action, which is followed by a STOP, indicating a sequential relationship."

entities.description: "LANI is an organization involved in evaluating the performance of approaches in task completion and stop distance accuracy."
"CHAI is an organization involved in evaluating the performance of approaches in stop distance and manipulation accuracy."
"CHAPLOT18 is an approach that is compared with others in terms of task completion accuracy on LANI."
"MISRA17 is an approach that is compared with others in terms of task completion accuracy on LANI."
"STOP is a baseline event used for comparison in performance metrics such as stop distance."
"RANDOMWALK is a baseline event used for comparison in performance metrics."
"MOSTFREQUENT is a baseline event used for comparison in performance metrics."
"Task Completion (TC) is a metric used to evaluate the accuracy of approaches in completing tasks."
"Stop Distance (SD) is a metric used to evaluate the accuracy of approaches in stopping at the correct location."
"Manipulation (MA) is a metric used to evaluate the accuracy of approaches in manipulation tasks."
"Janner et al. (2018) is a reference to a method that is outperformed by the described approach in goal prediction."
"Human Evaluation is a process used to assess the performance of approaches by comparing generated paths with instructions on a Likert scale."
"Likert Scale is a scale of 1–5 used by raters to evaluate if the generated path follows the instruction."
"Raters are individuals who evaluate the generated path, the reference path, and the instruction on a Likert scale."
"Horizon refers to the limit set for both domains during training, allowing additional steps to encourage learning after errors."
"Intermediate Goals are used in CHAI, with the horizon applied separately for each goal."
"Action Generation RNN is a component of the model that is ablated to demonstrate its importance."
"Language Input is a component of the model that is ablated to demonstrate its importance."
"Joint Learning is a component of the model that is ablated to demonstrate its importance."
"Oracle Goals are hypothetical goals used to evaluate the approach's performance in navigation tasks."
"Cascading Errors refer to the potential issue where errors in predicted goals lead to errors in action generation."
"Goal Prediction is a process that is explicitly separated from action generation in the proposed model."
"Action Generation is a process that relies on the predicted goal in the proposed model."

relationships.description: "LANI is used to evaluate the performance of CHAPLOT18 in task completion accuracy."
"LANI is used to evaluate the performance of MISRA17 in task completion accuracy."
"LANI uses STOP as a baseline for comparison in performance metrics."
"LANI uses RANDOMWALK as a baseline for comparison in performance metrics."
"LANI uses MOSTFREQUENT as a baseline for comparison in performance metrics."
"CHAI uses STOP as a baseline for comparison in performance metrics."
"CHAI uses RANDOMWALK as a baseline for comparison in performance metrics."
"CHAI uses MOSTFREQUENT as a baseline for comparison in performance metrics."
"CHAI is used to evaluate the performance of the approach by Janner et al. (2018) in goal prediction."
"Human Evaluation is conducted by Raters who assess the performance of approaches on a Likert scale."
"Human Evaluation uses the Likert Scale for raters to evaluate the generated path against the instruction."
"Goal Prediction is a separate process from Action Generation in the proposed model."

entities.description: "CHAI is an organization associated with the development of the CIFF project, as indicated by the GitHub repository."
"CIFF is a project developed by the CHAI organization, with code and data available on GitHub."
"LANI is a navigation domain used in the project, where actions include moving the agent and changing its orientation."
"CHALET is a house environment used in the project, where agent actions include moving, changing orientation, and object interaction."
"HCRC Map Task is an event that inspired LANI, involving a leader directing a follower to navigate between landmarks on a map."
"GitHub is the platform where the CIFF project's code and data are hosted."
"$\mathcal{X}$ represents the set of all instructions in the technical overview of the project."
"$\mathcal{S}$ represents the set of all world states in the technical overview of the project."
"$\boldsymbol{\mathcal{A}}$ represents the set of all actions in the technical overview of the project."
"STOP is the special action indicating execution completion in the agent's sequence of actions."
"The agent is the entity that executes instructions by generating a sequence of actions in the project's model."
"The agent context $\tilde{s}$ is defined as the agent's pose and an RGB image of the environment from its point of view."
"N represents the number of training data examples in the learning process of the project."
"M represents the number of test set examples in the evaluation process of the project."
"Chen and Mooney are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on mapping instruction to action."
"Kim and Mooney are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on mapping instruction to action."
"Artzi and Zettlemoyer are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on mapping instruction to action."
"Misra et al. are researchers cited multiple times in the related work section for their studies on mapping instruction to action and direct mapping from raw visual observations to actions."
"Xiong et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on direct mapping from raw visual observations to actions."
"Anderson et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on direct mapping from raw visual observations to actions and for the HCRC Map Task."
"Fried et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on direct mapping from raw visual observations to actions."
"Chaplot et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on using synthetic language for instruction following."
"Hermann et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on using synthetic language for instruction following."
"Sutton et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on hierarchical reinforcement learning."
"Oh et al. are researchers cited in the related work section for their study on mapping synthetic language to actions using a two-level hierarchy."

relationships.description: "CHAI is the organization responsible for the development of the CIFF project."
"LANI is a navigation domain utilized in the CIFF project."
"CHALET is a house environment used in the CIFF project for agent actions and state encoding."
"LANI is inspired by the HCRC Map Task, adapting the concept of navigation between landmarks."

entities.description: "LINGUNET is a system that includes various components such as CNNs, affine transformations, and RNNs, used for action generation and goal prediction."
"Peters and Schaal are referenced in the context of reinforcement learning, indicating their contribution to the field."
"Mnih et al. are mentioned in relation to reinforcement learning methods that require many samples due to high sample complexity."
"Misra et al. are referenced for their work on learning in a contextual bandit setting and mixing reinforcement and supervised learning."
"Xiong et al. are mentioned for their work on mixing reinforcement and supervised learning."
"Kingma and Ba are the authors of the Adam optimization method used for updating model parameters."
"Chaplot et al. are referenced in the context of a learned embedding lookup table for the current time."
"RNN refers to the Recurrent Neural Network used in the action generation process of LINGUNET."
"LSTM stands for Long Short-Term Memory, a type of RNN used in LINGUNET for action generation and goal prediction."
"CNN refers to Convolutional Neural Networks, which are part of the model parameters in LINGUNET."
"DECONV likely refers to Deconvolutional Networks, which are part of the model parameters in LINGUNET."
"AFFINE refers to the learned affine transformations within the LINGUNET model."
Adam is the optimization method used for updating model parameters in the LINGUNET model, also referred to as Adam Optimization.
"Policy Gradient is the method used for action generation in a contextual bandit setting within LINGUNET."
"Contextual Bandit is the setting used for action generation in LINGUNET, as referenced in the text."
"Supervised Learning is the method used to address the language understanding problem in LINGUNET."
"Reinforcement Learning is the method mentioned for tasks that benefit from exploration in the context of LINGUNET."
"Exploration is a concept related to the use of reinforcement learning in LINGUNET."
"Action Generation is a process in LINGUNET that involves generating actions using an RNN."
"Goal Prediction is a component of LINGUNET that predicts the goal state."
"Cross-Entropy is the measure used to train the goal prediction component by minimizing the error with the gold-standard goal distribution."
"Gold-Standard Goal Distribution is the deterministic distribution used as a reference for training the goal prediction component."
"Expected Immediate Reward is the objective for training action generation by maximizing the reward the agent observes."

relationships.description: "LINGUNET's action generation component is contrasted with the reinforcement learning methods of Peters and Schaal."
"LINGUNET's approach is compared to the reinforcement learning methods that Mnih et al. are known for, which have high sample complexity."
"LINGUNET's learning approach is informed by the work of Misra et al. on contextual bandit settings and the combination of reinforcement and supervised learning."
"LINGUNET's learning strategy is related to the approach of Xiong et al., which combines reinforcement and supervised learning."
"LINGUNET uses the Adam optimization method developed by Kingma and Ba for updating its model parameters."
"LINGUNET incorporates the learned embedding lookup table for the current time as described by Chaplot et al."
"LSTM is a type of RNN used in the LINGUNET model for action generation and goal prediction."
"CNNs are part of the model parameters within LINGUNET."
"DECONVs are part of the model parameters within LINGUNET."
"AFFINE transformations are part of the model parameters within LINGUNET."
"Adam is the optimization method used to update the model parameters in LINGUNET."
"Policy Gradient is used in the action generation process of LINGUNET."

entities.description: "The Department of Computer Science and Cornell Tech at Cornell University is the institution where the research was conducted."
"LINGUNET is a language-conditioned image generation network used in the research to map raw visual observations to goals."
"LANI is a benchmark for instruction following, specifically a navigation task used to evaluate the model's performance."
"CHAI is a benchmark for instruction following, where an agent executes household instructions, used to evaluate the model's performance."
"NY is the abbreviation for New York, indicating the state where the research was conducted."
"CHALET environment is a 3D house environment used in the CHAI benchmark for executing household instructions."
"Mei et al., 2016 is a reference to a previous study that proposed learning to directly map from inputs to actions."
"Suhr and Artzi, 2018 is a reference to a study that proposed learning to directly map from inputs to actions."
"Misra et al., 2017 is a reference to a study that proposed learning to directly map from inputs to actions using a single model."
"Xiong et al., 2018 is a reference to a study that proposed learning to directly map from inputs to actions."
"Ronneberger et al., 2015 is a reference to the study that introduced the U-NET image-to-image architecture used in LINGUNET."
"Yan et al., 2018 is a reference to a study that contributed to the CHALET environment used in the CHAI benchmark."
"ciff is the code name or identifier for the project where the code and data for this research are available."
"U-NET is the image-to-image architecture used as a basis for developing LINGUNET."
"RNN stands for Recurrent Neural Network, the method used to generate actions after goal prediction."

entities.description: "LANI is an organization that has inspired work related to data collection and navigation tasks, aiming for a larger corpus and interactive environment."
"The HCRC Map Task is an event or study conducted by Anderson et al., 1991, where a leader directs a follower to navigate between landmarks on a map."
"The SAIL navigation corpus is an event or study collected by MacMahon et al., 2006, abstracting away interaction challenges in navigation tasks."
"The ATIS collection process is an event or study conducted by Hemphill et al., 1990 and Dahl et al., 1994, used for collecting CHAI instructions."
"CHAI is an organization that collected instructions using scenarios given to workers, similar to the ATIS collection process."
"CHALET is a geographical location or environment used for CHAI, which is larger and has more complex manipulation compared to similar environments."
"The Room-to-Room dataset is an event or study by Anderson et al., 2018, that makes use of an environment of connected panoramas of house settings."
"Anderson et al., 1991 are researchers who conducted the HCRC Map Task, which inspired LANI's approach to navigation tasks."
"MacMahon et al., 2006 are researchers who collected the SAIL navigation corpus, which influenced LANI's approach to data collection."
"Hemphill et al., 1990 are researchers who contributed to the ATIS collection process, which was used for collecting CHAI instructions."
"Dahl et al., 1994 are researchers who contributed to the ATIS collection process, which was used for collecting CHAI instructions."
"Hermann et al., 2017 are researchers who released multiple 3D research environments, which are compared to LANI's navigation environments."
"Chaplot et al., 2018 are researchers who released multiple 3D research environments, which are compared to LANI's navigation environments."
"Gordon et al., 2018 are researchers who contributed to the CHALET environment, which is used for CHAI."
"Das et al., 2018 are researchers who contributed to the CHALET environment, which is used for CHAI."
"Anderson et al., 2018 are researchers who created the Room-to-Room dataset, which is compared to LANI's environments."

relationships.description: "LANI is inspired by the HCRC Map Task, using a similar task but with a scalable data collection process and an interactive navigation environment."
"LANI's approach to data collection abstracts away interaction challenges, similar to how the SAIL navigation corpus was collected."
"CHAI instructions were collected using scenarios given to workers, similar to the ATIS collection process."
"LANI has a significantly larger state space than existing navigation environments, including the environment used for CHAI."
"CHALET is the environment used for CHAI, which is larger and has more complex manipulation compared to similar environments."
"Unlike LANI, the Room-to-Room dataset provides a realistic vision challenge but has a limited state space and no manipulation."
"LANI is inspired by the work of Anderson et al., 1991, who conducted the HCRC Map Task."
"LANI's approach to data collection is influenced by the SAIL navigation corpus collected by MacMahon et al., 2006."
"CHAI instructions were collected using a process similar to the ATIS collection process conducted by Hemphill et al., 1990."
"CHAI instructions were collected using a process similar to the ATIS collection process conducted by Dahl et al., 1994."
"LANI has a significantly larger state space than the navigation environments released by Hermann et al., 2017."
"LANI has a significantly larger state space than the navigation environments released by Chaplot et al., 2018."
"The environment used for CHAI, CHALET, is influenced by the work of Gordon et al., 2018."
"The environment used for CHAI, CHALET, is influenced by the work of Das et al., 2018."

"LINGUNET is an architecture inspired by the U-NET image generation method, used for generating a probability distribution over pixels in a feature map based on natural language instructions."
"LeCun et al., 1998 are credited with the development of the CNN with rectified linear units (ReLU), which is part of the LINGUNET architecture."
"Nair and Hinton, 2010 are associated with the development of rectified linear units (ReLU), used in the CNN within the LINGUNET architecture."
"Ronneberger et al., 2015 are credited with the U-NET image generation method, which inspired the LINGUNET architecture."
"Maas et al., 2013 are associated with the development of leaky ReLU non-linearities, used in the LINGUNET architecture."
"Ulyanov et al., 2016 are associated with the development of instance normalization, used in the LINGUNET architecture."
"Srivastava et al., 2014 are credited with the development of dropout regularization, used in the LINGUNET architecture."
"Hochreiter and Schmidhuber, 1997 are credited with the development of the long short-term memory (LSTM) RNN, used in the process of generating representations from instructions."
"CNN refers to a convolutional neural network, which is a part of the LINGUNET architecture and is used for feature extraction from the initial panorama observation."
"ReLU stands for rectified linear units, a type of activation function used in the CNN layers within the LINGUNET architecture."
"Positional embeddings are used in the feature map generation process to incorporate positional information into the CNN output."
"LSTM refers to a long short-term memory network, which is used to map the instruction to a sequence of hidden states."
"The instruction is a sequence of natural language commands that are used to guide the LINGUNET architecture in generating the goal prediction."
"A feature map is a representation used in the LINGUNET architecture, generated from the initial panorama observation and used for goal prediction."
"The goal mask is a part of the LINGUNET architecture, computed based on the predicted goal location and used as input to an RNN for action generation."
"RNN refers to a recurrent neural network, which is used in the LINGUNET architecture to output actions based on the goal mask."
"A probability distribution is generated over a feature map by LINGUNET, representing the likelihood of different areas being the goal location."
"The goal location is the predicted destination in the environment, inferred from the max probability in the probability distribution generated by LINGUNET."
"The agent refers to the entity executing actions in the environment, using the goal prediction and action generation components of the LINGUNET architecture."
"The panorama observation is the initial input to the LINGUNET architecture, from which a feature map is generated."
"Backward camera projection is the process used to identify the 3D location in the environment corresponding to the goal pixel in the feature map."
"Softmax is a function applied to the feature map to generate the probability distribution over the goal location."
"The learned scalar bias term is an additional component in the softmax function, representing events where the goal is out of sight."
"DROPOUT is a regularization technique used in the LINGUNET architecture to prevent overfitting."
"DECONV refers to the deconvolution operation used in the LINGUNET architecture to generate a sequence of feature maps during the reconstruction phase."
"AFFINE transformation is used to create a 1x1 kernel from the instruction representation, which is then used in the convolution process."
"The text kernel is a 1x1 kernel generated from the instruction representation, used in the convolution process to create a text-conditioned feature map."
"A text-conditioned feature map is a feature map generated by applying a text kernel to the feature map, incorporating natural language instruction information."

relationships.description: "LINGUNET is inspired by the CNN architecture developed by LeCun et al., 1998, which includes ReLU units."
"LINGUNET uses rectified linear units (ReLU), which were introduced by Nair and Hinton, 2010."
"LINGUNET is based on the U-NET image generation method by Ronneberger et al., 2015, with modifications for natural language instructions."
"LINGUNET incorporates leaky ReLU non-linearities, which were developed by Maas et al., 2013."
"LINGUNET uses instance normalization, a technique developed by Ulyanov et al., 2016."
"LINGUNET employs dropout regularization, a technique introduced by Srivastava et al., 2014."
"LINGUNET is used in conjunction with LSTM RNN, which was developed by Hochreiter and Schmidhuber, 1997, for instruction representation."
